metadata.title: CVE-2017-7839 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Control characters prepended before "javascript:" URLs pasted in theaddressbar can cause the leading characters to be ignored and the pastedJavaScript to be executed instead of being blocked. This could be used insocial engineering and self-cross-site-scripting (self-XSS) attacks whereusers are convinced to copy and paste text into the addressbar. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 57.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-globalmenu - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-mozsymbols - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
firefox-testsuite - 57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '57.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.5').
